Diskusi Buku dan Menulis Sastra Ramaikan Galeri Soemardja ITB
04 Nov 2019, 08:38 by Anwar Siswadi (Kontributor), Istiqomatul Hayati
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Komunitas literasi di Bandung menggelar pameran buku mulai 4-8 November 2019. Bertempat di Galeri Soemardja Institut Teknologi Bandung, panitia meramaikan acara dengan diskusi buku-buku baru, kiat menulis sastra, hingga pemasaran buku. Pengunjung bisa datang dan mengikutinya tanpa biaya.
Koordinator Acara Soemardja Book Fair 2019, Taufik Ramadhan Barli mengatakan, tema kegiatan tahunan sejak 2017 itu sekarang bertajuk Potensi Literasi di Era 4.0. Tema itu dinilai sangat relevan dengan kondisi hari ini yang berdampak pada berbagai sektor kehidupan termasuk literasi.
Sebuah masalah yang diangkat misalnya soal pembajakan buku. “Penulis makin sering menemukan tindak plagiasi oleh oknum,” katanya, Senin 4 November 2019. Sementara bagi kalangan penerbit, masalah pembajakan buku cetak maupun elektronik merugikan usahanya.
Pameran menghadirkan 15 pelapak buku dengan judul beragam. Pesertanya antara lain Teras Buku, Lawang Buku, Katarsis Books, Akasa Book Store, dan Delunapetite Shop. Kemudian ada Toco.buruan.co, Bukunesia, Rasia Bandoeng, Katalis Books, James Books, dan Petra Books.
Agendanya setelah pembukaan, Senin, 4 November 2019 ada bedah buku Googling Gutenberg bersama Atep Kurnia penulisnya dari pukul 15.30-17.30. Jadwal Selasa, 5 November 2019, mulai pukul 10.00-12.00 WIB diskusi bincang karya komunitas bersama Aksara Salman ITB dan FLP Kota Bandung.
Lanjut pada pukul 13.00-15.00 WIB ada diskusi strategi pemasaran buku di era digital bersama penulis Triatni Retno dan Mizan Store. Sore harinya pukul 15.30-17.30, diskusi tentang pembajakan buku bersama Ariel Seraphino dari Klub Baca Bandung dan Benny Ramdhani, CEO Penerbit Pastell Books.
Hari ketiga, Rabu, 6 November 2019 mulai pukul 10.00-12.00 WIB diskusi soal kiat menulis novel remaja bersama penulis Ari Nilandari. Kemudian pukul 13.00-15.00 digelar bedah buku baru berjudul Toponimi bersama T. Bahctiar penulisnya dan pegiat Rumah Baca Buku Sunda.
Berlanjut pukul 15.30-17.30 ada lokakarya Bookstagram bersama Komunitas Bookstagram Bandung. Sementara pada Kamis, 7 November 2019 mulai pukul 10.00-12.00 dihelat diskusi dinamika literasi kampus dari komunitas buku Universitas Pendidikan Indonesia dan Institut Teknologi Nasional Bandung.
Setelah itu pada pukul 13.00-15.00, sastrawan muda Rendy Jean Satria menggelar lokakarya menulis puisi. Selanjutnya pukul 15.30-17.30 ada diskusi rahasia menulis karya Bestseller di platform digital bersama Jia Effendie, Editor Senior Storial.co.

ANWAR SISWADI
text:
Book Discussion and Literary Writing Enliven the Soemardja Gallery at ITB
04 Nov 2019, 08:38 by Anwar Siswadi (Contributor), Istiqomatul Hayati
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - The literacy community in Bandung holds book fairs from November 4-8, 2019. Located at the Soemardja Gallery of the Bandung Institute of Technology, the committee enlivens the event with discussions on new books, literary writing tips, and book marketing. Visitors can come and follow them at no charge.
The 2019 Soemardja Book Fair Event Coordinator, Taufik Ramadhan Barli said, the theme of the annual activity since 2017 was now titled Potential Literacy in Era 4.0. The theme is considered very relevant to today's conditions that have an impact on various sectors of life including literacy.
A problem raised for example is the book piracy. "The author more often finds acts of plagiarism by individuals," he said, Monday 4 November 2019. While for publishers, the issue of pirating printed and electronic books harmed his business.
The exhibition presented 15 book owners with various titles. Participants include the Terrace of Books, Book Lines, Katarsis Books, Akasa Book Store, and Delunapetite Shop. Then there are Toco.buruan.co, Bukunesia, Rasia Bandoeng, Catalyst Books, James Books, and Petra Books.
The agenda is after the opening, Monday, November 4, 2019, there will be a book review of Googling Gutenberg with Atep Kurnia, the writer from 15: 30-17: 30. Schedule Tuesday, November 5, 2019, starting at 10.00-12.00 WIB discussing community work with Aksara Salman ITB and FLP Bandung.
Then at 13.00-15.00 WIB there was a discussion of book marketing strategies in the digital era with the writers Triatni Retno and Mizan Store. In the afternoon at 15.30-17.30, a discussion about book piracy with Ariel Seraphino from Bandung Reading Club and Benny Ramdhani, CEO of Pastell Books Publisher.
The third day, Wednesday, November 6, 2019 starting at 10.00-12.00 WIB discussion about tips on writing teen novels with writer Ari Nilandari. Then at 13.00-15.00 a new book review was held titled Toponimi with T. Bahctiar the writer and activist of the Sundanese Book Reading House.
Continuing at 3.30-17.30 there is a Bookstagram workshop with the Bandung Bookstagram Community. While on Thursday, November 7, 2019 starting at 10.00-12.00, there was a discussion on the dynamics of campus literacy from the book community of Universitas Pendidikan Indonesia and Bandung National Institute of Technology.
After that, at 13.00-15.00, young writer Rendy Jean Satria held a poetry writing workshop. Then at 15.30-17.30 there was a secret discussion writing Bestseller's work on the digital platform with Jia Effendie, Senior Editor of Storial.co.

ANWAR SISWADI
